titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. James R. James the Seventh, by the grace of God, King of Scotland, England, France, and Ireland, Defender of the Faith, &c. To all and sundry our good subjects, whom these presents do or may concern, greeting. Since our accession to the throne of our royal ancestors, our chiefest care has been to procure the security, peace and happiness of our subjects, ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James VII)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

titleStmt.title: By the King, a proclamation. James R. James the Seventh, by the grace of God, King of Scotland, England, France, and Ireland, Defender of the Faith, &c. To all and sundry our good subjects, whom these presents do or may concern, greeting. Since our accession to the throne of our royal ancestors, our chiefest care has been to procure the security, peace and happiness of our subjects, ...
titleStmt.author: Scotland. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James VII)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Edinburgh, printed by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to His most sacred Majesty: and reprinted at London by George Croom at the Blew Ball in Thames-street, 1688. With allowance,

notesStmt.note: "Confirming the Proclamation for Liberty of Conscience in Scotland." -- Steele.
Title from caption title and first lines of text.
At end of text: Given under our royal hand and signet at our court at Whitehall the 7th day of May 1688, and of our reign the fourth year.
With an order to print at end, dated: Edinburgh May 15. 1688.
Steele notation: Arms 258 Subjects Our be.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
